task_1.query_used: Search LinkedIn for Aqib Ilyas cricket player profiles and professional connections in Oman sports organizations
task_1.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer representing the Oman national team. A right-handed top-order batsman and right-arm off-spin bowler, Ilyas has been a consistent performer since his T20 International debut against Hong Kong on November 21, 2015. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

In One Day Internationals (ODIs), Ilyas has played 32 matches, scoring 1,234 runs at an average of 44.07, including two centuries and nine half-centuries. His highest ODI score is an unbeaten 109. With the ball, he has taken 23 wickets, with best figures of 4/36. ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/aqib-ilyas-940593?utm_source=openai))

In T20 Internationals, he has featured in 56 matches, amassing 1,330 runs at an average of 27.70, with a top score of 90. He has also claimed 47 wickets, with best bowling figures of 4/10. ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/aqib-ilyas-940593?utm_source=openai))

Ilyas made history by becoming the first Omani cricketer to score an international century, achieving an unbeaten 109 against Nepal in February 2020. He followed this with another century, scoring 105 against the United States in the same series. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

Regarding his professional connections within Oman's sports organizations, specific details are not readily available in the provided sources. For the most accurate and up-to-date information, it is recommended to consult official profiles or contact Oman's cricket board directly.

citations.title: Aqib Ilyas

task_2.query_used: Investigate Oman Cricket Association official records and player registrations for Aqib Ilyas
task_2.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer representing Oman. He is a right-handed top-order batsman and bowls right-arm off-spin. Ilyas made his Twenty20 International (T20I) debut for Oman against Hong Kong on November 21, 2015, and his One Day International (ODI) debut against Namibia on April 27, 2019. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

In his ODI career, Ilyas has played 32 matches, scoring 1,234 runs at an average of 44.00, including two centuries and nine half-centuries. His highest ODI score is 109 not out. In T20Is, he has appeared in 53 matches, amassing 1,284 runs with an average of 29.00, and a top score of 90. ([mykhel.com](https://www.mykhel.com/cricket/players/aqib-ilyas-p10980/?utm_source=openai))

Ilyas has also contributed with the ball, taking 23 wickets in ODIs with a best bowling figure of 4/36, and 45 wickets in T20Is with a best of 4/10. ([mykhel.com](https://www.mykhel.com/cricket/players/aqib-ilyas-p10980/?utm_source=openai))

In May 2024, Ilyas was appointed captain of the Oman national team for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, succeeding Zeeshan Maqsood. ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/story/aqib-ilyas-takes-over-as-captain-as-oman-announce-t20-world-cup-squad-1431787?utm_source=openai))

For the most current and detailed records, including player registrations and official statistics, it is advisable to consult the Oman Cricket Association's official website or contact them directly.

task_3.query_used: Search local Oman government sports ministry databases and athlete registries for Aqib Ilyas
task_3.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer representing the Oman national team. His family relocated to Oman when he was six months old, and he grew up in Muscat. Ilyas is a right-handed top-order batsman and an off-spin bowler. He made his Twenty20 International (T20I) debut for Oman against Hong Kong on November 21, 2015. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

In April 2019, Ilyas made his One Day International (ODI) debut against Namibia. He has since become a key player for Oman, amassing 1,234 runs in 32 ODIs at an average of 42.55, including two centuries and nine fifties. His highest ODI score is an unbeaten 109 against Nepal. In T20Is, he has scored 1,220 runs in 53 matches, averaging 27.11, with a top score of 90 against the UAE. ([sports.ndtv.com](https://sports.ndtv.com/cricket/players/110169-aqib-ilyas-playerprofile?utm_source=openai))

Ilyas has also contributed significantly with the ball, taking 23 wickets in ODIs and 42 in T20Is. His best bowling figures in ODIs are 4/36 against Nepal, and in T20Is, he achieved 4/10 against Bahrain. ([sports.ndtv.com](https://sports.ndtv.com/cricket/players/110169-aqib-ilyas-playerprofile?utm_source=openai))

In May 2024, Ilyas was appointed captain of the Oman national team, succeeding Zeeshan Maqsood. Under his leadership, Oman participated in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024, co-hosted by the West Indies and the USA. ([omancricket.org](https://www.omancricket.org/ilyas-lead-oman-t20-world-cup-2024/?utm_source=openai))

Ilyas has faced personal challenges, including a benign tumor on his ankle bone in 2021, which required surgery and an 18-month rehabilitation period. He successfully returned to cricket, leading Oman to qualify for the 2024 T20 World Cup. ([cricket.com](https://www.cricket.com/news/all-rounder-aqib-ilyas-leads-oman-to-2024-t20-world-cup-qualification-11302023-1701345554903?utm_source=openai))

As of June 2025, Ilyas continues to be a pivotal figure in Omani cricket, contributing both as a player and a leader.

task_4.query_used: Explore Times of Oman, Oman Observer, and Muscat Daily archives for news articles mentioning Aqib Ilyas cricket
task_4.data:
Aqib Ilyas has been a pivotal figure in Omani cricket, with several notable mentions in local news outlets:

- **October 2023**: Ilyas delivered a rapid 63 runs off 24 balls, propelling Oman to a 22-run victory over Singapore in the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup Asia Qualifier Final. This win secured Oman's spot in the semi-finals. ([timesofoman.com](https://timesofoman.com/article/137913-ilyas-blitz-powers-oman-into-semis?utm_source=openai))

- **May 2024**: He was appointed captain of the national team for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024, succeeding Zeeshan Maqsood. Ilyas expressed determination to showcase Oman's talent on the global stage. ([cdn-2.timesofoman.com](https://cdn-2.timesofoman.com/article/145028-ilyas-to-lead-oman-at-t20-world-cup?utm_source=openai))

- **June 2024**: Ahead of a match against Namibia, Ilyas expressed confidence in Oman's preparations, highlighting the team's acclimatization to local conditions and their readiness to perform. ([muscatdaily.com](https://www.muscatdaily.com/2024/06/02/oman-cricket-33/?utm_source=openai))

- **July 2023**: Ilyas led Oman A in the Emerging Teams Asia Cup in Sri Lanka, following the team's commendable performance in the ICC Men’s Cricket World Cup Qualifier in Zimbabwe. ([muscatdaily.com](https://www.muscatdaily.com/2023/07/12/emerging-teams-asia-cup/?utm_source=openai))

- **September 2023**: He captained Oman in the inaugural Gulf T20I Cricket Championship in Qatar, stepping in for the regular skipper Zeeshan Maqsood. ([timesofoman.com](https://timesofoman.com/a/136013?utm_source=openai))

These instances underscore Ilyas's significant contributions and leadership roles in advancing Omani cricket on both regional and international platforms.

citations.title: Ilyas’ blitz powers Oman into semis - Times of Oman
Ilyas to lead Oman at T20 World Cup - Times of Oman
Oman favourites against Namibia, says captain Ilyas - Muscat Daily
Aqib Ilyas to lead Oman A at Emerging Teams Asia Cup in Sri Lanka - Muscat Daily
Aqib Ilyas-led Oman team departs for first Gulf T20I Cricket Championship in Qatar from September 15 - Times of Oman

task_5.query_used: Search ICC (International Cricket Council) player databases and statistics for Aqib Ilyas representing Oman
task_5.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer representing the Oman national team. A right-handed top-order batsman and right-arm off-spin bowler, Ilyas has been a key figure in Omani cricket since his international debut in 2015. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

**International Career:**

- **One-Day Internationals (ODIs):** Ilyas made his ODI debut on April 27, 2019, against Namibia. As of June 2025, he has played 32 ODIs, amassing 1,234 runs at an average of 44.07, including two centuries and eight half-centuries. His highest ODI score is 109 not out. With the ball, he has taken 20 wickets at an average of 27.6, with best figures of 4/36. ([mykhel.com](https://www.mykhel.com/cricket/players/aqib-ilyas-p10980/?utm_source=openai))

- **Twenty20 Internationals (T20Is):** Ilyas debuted in T20Is on November 21, 2015, against Hong Kong. He has featured in 53 T20Is, scoring 1,284 runs at an average of 29.13, with a top score of 90. He has also contributed with the ball, taking 38 wickets at an average of 16.05, with best figures of 4/10. ([mykhel.com](https://www.mykhel.com/cricket/players/aqib-ilyas-p10980/?utm_source=openai))

**Notable Performances:**

- In February 2020, during the Nepal Tri-Nation Series, Ilyas scored Oman's first-ever ODI century, an unbeaten 109 against Nepal. He followed this with another century, scoring 105 against the United States in the same series. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

- In May 2024, Ilyas was appointed captain of Oman's squad for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup. During a warm-up match against Afghanistan, he top-scored with an unbeaten 66 off 48 balls, leading Oman to a total of 154/3 before the match was abandoned due to rain. ([cricket.com](https://www.cricket.com/news/icc-t20-world-cup-2024-warm-up-recap-aqib-ilyas-shines-in-the-rain-curtailed-warm-up-between-oman-and-afghanistan-5302024-1717067917072?utm_source=openai))

**Personal Background:**

Ilyas moved to Oman with his family when he was six months old and grew up in Muscat. He pursued civil engineering studies in Dubai and was invited to train with the UAE national team but chose to return to Oman after completing his degree. In 2021, he underwent surgery to remove a benign tumor from his ankle, which required an 18-month rehabilitation period. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

Aqib Ilyas continues to be a vital player for Oman, contributing significantly with both bat and ball, and leading the team in major international tournaments.

task_6.query_used: Investigate ESPNCricinfo and Cricbuzz player profiles and match records for Aqib Ilyas Oman cricket team
task_6.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer for the Oman national team. A right-handed top-order batsman and right-arm off-spin bowler, he has been a key player for Oman since his debut in 2015. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

**International Career:**

- **T20 International (T20I) Debut:** November 21, 2015, against Hong Kong.
- **One Day International (ODI) Debut:** April 27, 2019, against Namibia.

**Career Highlights:**

- **ODI Performance:** In 32 matches, Ilyas has scored 1,234 runs at an average of 42.55, including two centuries and nine half-centuries. His highest score is an unbeaten 109 against Nepal. ([sports.ndtv.com](https://sports.ndtv.com/cricket/players/110169-aqib-ilyas-playerprofile?utm_source=openai))
- **T20I Performance:** Over 53 matches, he has accumulated 1,220 runs with an average of 27.11, featuring nine half-centuries and a top score of 90 against the UAE. ([sports.ndtv.com](https://sports.ndtv.com/cricket/players/110169-aqib-ilyas-playerprofile?utm_source=openai))
- **Bowling:** Ilyas has taken 23 wickets in ODIs with a best of 4/36 and 42 wickets in T20Is with a best of 4/10. ([sports.ndtv.com](https://sports.ndtv.com/cricket/players/110169-aqib-ilyas-playerprofile?utm_source=openai))

**Leadership:**

In May 2024, Ilyas was appointed captain of Oman's squad for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, succeeding Zeeshan Maqsood. ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/story/aqib-ilyas-takes-over-as-captain-as-oman-announce-t20-world-cup-squad-1431787?utm_source=openai))

**Notable Achievements:**

- Ilyas became the first Omani batsman to score an ODI century, achieving an unbeaten 109 against Nepal on February 9, 2020. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))
- He has been instrumental in Oman's T20 World Cup campaigns, participating in seven matches between 2021 and 2024, scoring 135 runs with a highest score of 50*. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oman_at_the_Men%27s_T20_World_Cup?utm_source=openai))

**Personal Background:**

Ilyas moved to Oman with his family when he was six months old and grew up in Muscat. He pursued civil engineering in Dubai before returning to Oman to focus on his cricket career. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

Aqib Ilyas continues to be a pivotal figure in Omani cricket, contributing significantly with both bat and ball.

task_8.query_used: Explore Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter for verified accounts of Aqib Ilyas cricket player Oman
task_8.data:
Aqib Ilyas, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer representing Oman. He is a right-handed top-order batsman and bowls right-arm off-spin. Ilyas made his Twenty20 International (T20I) debut for Oman against Hong Kong on November 21, 2015. In April 2019, he earned his One Day International (ODI) cap against Namibia. Notably, on February 8, 2020, he became the first Omani player to score an ODI century, achieving an unbeaten 109 runs against Nepal. ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/aqib-ilyas-940593?utm_source=openai))

In May 2024, Ilyas was appointed as the captain of the Omani national team for the T20 World Cup. Expressing his gratitude, he stated, "I am truly honoured to be entrusted with the captaincy. It's a huge responsibility, and I aim to lead the team to many victories." ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/story/aqib-ilyas-takes-over-as-captain-as-oman-announce-t20-world-cup-squad-1431787?utm_source=openai))

Regarding his social media presence, Ilyas maintains an active Instagram account under the handle [@aqibilyascricketer](https://www.instagram.com/aqibilyascricketer/). However, there is no verified information about his official accounts on Facebook or Twitter.

task_9.query_used: Search Gulf News, Khaleej Times sports sections for coverage of Aqib Ilyas in regional cricket tournaments
task_9.data:
As of June 11, 2025, there is no specific coverage of Aqib Ilyas in the sports sections of Gulf News or Khaleej Times. However, Aqib Ilyas has been prominently featured in other regional publications for his significant contributions to Omani cricket.

In September 2023, Ilyas captained Oman to victory in the inaugural Gulf T20I Cricket Championship held in Doha, Qatar. He led from the front, scoring 67 runs in the final against the UAE, guiding his team to a five-wicket win. ([thepeninsulaqatar.com](https://thepeninsulaqatar.com/article/24/09/2023/oman-beat-uae-to-win-gulf-t20-title?utm_source=openai))

Earlier in 2023, Ilyas overcame a challenging period after recovering from a bone tumor that sidelined him for 18 months. His return to cricket was marked by impressive performances, including a half-century against Ireland in the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup Qualifier in Zimbabwe. ([thenationalnews.com](https://www.thenationalnews.com/sport/cricket/2023/06/22/life-first-then-cricket-for-aqib-ilyas-after-recovering-from-bone-cancer-scare/?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, in July 2023, Ilyas was appointed captain of Oman A for the Emerging Teams Asia Cup in Sri Lanka, reflecting his leadership and pivotal role in Omani cricket. ([timesofoman.com](https://timesofoman.com/article/133300-aqib-ilyas-to-lead-oman-a-at-emerging-teams-asia-cup?utm_source=openai))

While Gulf News and Khaleej Times have not covered these events, other regional outlets have highlighted Ilyas's resilience and contributions to the sport.

citations.title: Oman beat UAE to win Gulf T20 title | The Peninsula Qatar
‘Life first, then cricket’ for Aqib Ilyas after recovering from bone cancer scare | The National
Aqib Ilyas to lead Oman A at Emerging Teams Asia Cup I Times of Oman - Times of Oman

task_10.query_used: Investigate Oman residential visa and work permit databases through publicly accessible government portals for Aqib Ilyas
task_10.data:
Accessing individual visa or work permit information in Oman is restricted to authorized personnel and the individuals themselves. The Royal Oman Police (ROP) provides an online service for applicants to check their visa status using their application reference number and passport details. This service is accessible through the ROP's official website. ([rop.gov.om](https://www.rop.gov.om/english/Visas.aspx/copyright.aspx?utm_source=openai))

Regarding Aqib Ilyas, publicly available information indicates that he is a Pakistani-born cricketer who has represented the Oman national cricket team since 2015. Born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, his family moved to Oman when he was six months old. He grew up in Muscat and pursued civil engineering studies in Dubai before returning to Oman to continue his cricket career. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

Given his long-term residence and professional engagement in Oman, it is reasonable to infer that he holds the necessary residency and work permits. However, specific details about his visa or work permit status are not publicly disclosed.

citations.title: Royal Oman Police
Aqib Ilyas

task_11.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a cricketer who has represented the Oman national team since 2015. His family relocated to Oman when he was six months old, and he was raised in Muscat. In 2010, Ilyas moved to Dubai to pursue a degree in civil engineering. During his time in Dubai, he was invited to train with the United Arab Emirates national cricket team but chose to return to Oman after completing his studies. task_12.query_used: Explore YouTube and cricket video platforms for match footage or interviews featuring Aqib Ilyas playing for Oman national team
task_12.data:
Aqib Ilyas, a prominent figure in Oman's national cricket team, has been featured in various match footage and interviews available online. Here are some notable instances:

- **Match Footage**: In a T20 World Cup 2024 match against Australia, Ilyas showcased his fielding prowess by executing a diving catch to dismiss Glenn Maxwell. This moment is highlighted in an article by Sportskeeda. ([sportskeeda.com](https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/3-breathtaking-catches-oman-players-biggest-stage-ft-aqib-ilyas?utm_source=openai))

- **Interview**: Following a match-winning century against the USA, Ilyas reflected on his performance in an interview with ESPN. ([espn.com](https://www.espn.com/video/clip/_/id/25295002?utm_source=openai))

- **Match Highlights**: During the ICC Cricket World Cup League Two 2023-27, Ilyas scored 61 runs off 98 balls against Canada. Detailed highlights of his innings are available on Cricbuzz. ([m.cricbuzz.com](https://m.cricbuzz.com/player-match-highlights/107009/1/12235/batting?utm_source=openai))

These resources provide insights into Ilyas's contributions to Oman's cricketing successes.

report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Aqib Ilyas

**Report Date:** June 11, 2025

### Executive Summary

Aqib Ilyas is a Pakistani-born cricketer representing Oman's national team. He is a right-handed batsman and off-spin bowler, serving as Oman's captain as of May 2024. No red flags were identified based on the provided OSINT.

### Thematic Summary of Key Findings

**Professional / Career Background**
- Cricketer for the Oman national team.
- Captain of the Oman national team (appointed May 2024).
- Has represented Oman in T20 Internationals (since 2015) and One Day Internationals (ODI).
- Has played 32 ODIs, scored 1,234 runs, with an average of 44.07, including two centuries and nine half-centuries. Highest ODI score is 109*. 

**Business & Financial Activity**
- No information found in provided sources.

**Legal or Criminal Mentions**
- No information found in provided sources.

**Academic / Public Recognition**
- Pursued a degree in civil engineering in Dubai (completed around 2015).
- Featured in news articles for key performances, including a match-winning 63 runs off 24 balls against Singapore in October 2023 ([timesofoman.com](https://timesofoman.com/article/137913-ilyas-blitz-powers-oman-into-semis?utm_source=openai)).
- Praised for a diving catch to dismiss Glenn Maxwell in a T20 World Cup 2024 match against Australia ([sportskeeda.com](https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/3-breathtaking-catches-oman-players-biggest-stage-ft-aqib-ilyas?utm_source=openai)).
- Interviewed after a match-winning century against the USA ([espn.com](https://www.espn.com/video/clip/_/id/25295002?utm_source=openai)).

**Online / Social Presence**
- Presence confirmed via ESPNcricinfo profile ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/aqib-ilyas-940593?utm_source=openai)) and various news articles and match footage. 

**Other Notable Mentions**
- Born in Sialkot, Pakistan on September 5, 1992.
- Family relocated to Oman when he was six months old, raised in Muscat.
- Briefly trained with the UAE national cricket team while studying in Dubai.


### Risk Profile

Based on the available OSINT, Aqib Ilyas presents a **low reputational risk**. He is a recognized sportsman with positive media coverage and no indications of legal or criminal activity.

Missing citation for the claim about briefly training with UAE national cricket team
No evidence provided for 'No red flags' claim - this is an assessment rather than a fact from the evidence
judgement.revised_report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Aqib Ilyas

**Report Date:** June 11, 2025

### Executive Summary

Aqib Ilyas is a Pakistani-born cricketer representing Oman's national team. He is a right-handed batsman and off-spin bowler, serving as Oman's captain as of May 2024. Based on available OSINT sources, no adverse information was identified.

### Thematic Summary of Key Findings

**Professional / Career Background**
- Cricketer for the Oman national team since 2015¹
- Captain of the Oman national team (appointed May 2024)²
- Has represented Oman in T20 Internationals (since November 21, 2015) and One Day Internationals (ODI)¹
- Has played 32 ODIs, scored 1,234 runs, with an average of 44.07, including two centuries and nine half-centuries. Highest ODI score is 109*¹
- In T20 Internationals: 56 matches, 1,330 runs at an average of 27.70, with a top score of 90¹
- First Omani cricketer to score an international century (109* vs Nepal, February 2020)¹

**Business & Financial Activity**
- No information found in provided sources.

**Legal or Criminal Mentions**
- No information found in provided sources.

**Academic / Public Recognition**
- Moved to Dubai in 2010 to pursue a degree in civil engineering³
- During his time in Dubai, was invited to train with the UAE national cricket team but chose to return to Oman after completing his studies³
- Featured in news articles for key performances, including a match-winning 63 runs off 24 balls against Singapore in October 2023²
- Praised for a diving catch to dismiss Glenn Maxwell in a T20 World Cup 2024 match against Australia⁴
- Interviewed after a match-winning century against the USA⁴

**Online / Social Presence**
- Presence confirmed via ESPNcricinfo profile¹ and various news articles and match footage

**Other Notable Mentions**
- Born in Sialkot, Pakistan on September 5, 1992¹
- Family relocated to Oman when he was six months old, raised in Muscat¹
- Led Oman A in the Emerging Teams Asia Cup in Sri Lanka (July 2023)²
- Captained Oman in the inaugural Gulf T20I Cricket Championship in Qatar (September 2023)²

### Risk Profile

Based on the available OSINT, Aqib Ilyas presents a **low reputational risk**. He is a recognized sportsman with positive media coverage and no indications of legal, criminal, or controversial activity.

### Sources
¹ ESPNcricinfo and Wikipedia profiles
² Times of Oman and Muscat Daily archives
³ Wikipedia (educational background)
⁴ Sportskeeda and ESPN video content

task_1.query_used: Search LinkedIn for Aqib Ilyas cricket player profiles and professional connections in Oman sports organizations
task_1.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer representing the Oman national team. A right-handed top-order batsman and right-arm off-spin bowler, Ilyas has been a consistent performer since his T20 International debut against Hong Kong on November 21, 2015. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

In One Day Internationals (ODIs), Ilyas has played 32 matches, scoring 1,234 runs at an average of 44.07, including two centuries and nine half-centuries. His highest ODI score is an unbeaten 109. With the ball, he has taken 23 wickets, with best figures of 4/36. ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/aqib-ilyas-940593?utm_source=openai))

In T20 Internationals, he has featured in 56 matches, amassing 1,330 runs at an average of 27.70, with a top score of 90. He has also claimed 47 wickets, with best bowling figures of 4/10. ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/aqib-ilyas-940593?utm_source=openai))

Ilyas made history by becoming the first Omani cricketer to score an international century, achieving an unbeaten 109 against Nepal in February 2020. He followed this with another century, scoring 105 against the United States in the same series. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

Regarding his professional connections within Oman's sports organizations, specific details are not readily available in the provided sources. For the most accurate and up-to-date information, it is recommended to consult official profiles or contact Oman's cricket board directly.

citations.title: Aqib Ilyas
Aqib Ilyas Profile - Cricket Player Oman | Stats, Records, Video
Aqib Ilyas Profile - Cricket Player Oman | Stats, Records, Video
Aqib Ilyas

task_4.query_used: Explore Times of Oman, Oman Observer, and Muscat Daily archives for news articles mentioning Aqib Ilyas cricket
task_4.data:
Aqib Ilyas has been a pivotal figure in Omani cricket, with several notable mentions in local news outlets:

- **October 2023**: Ilyas delivered a rapid 63 runs off 24 balls, propelling Oman to a 22-run victory over Singapore in the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup Asia Qualifier Final. This win secured Oman's spot in the semi-finals. ([timesofoman.com](https://timesofoman.com/article/137913-ilyas-blitz-powers-oman-into-semis?utm_source=openai))

- **May 2024**: He was appointed captain of the national team for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024, succeeding Zeeshan Maqsood. Ilyas expressed determination to showcase Oman's talent on the global stage. ([cdn-2.timesofoman.com](https://cdn-2.timesofoman.com/article/145028-ilyas-to-lead-oman-at-t20-world-cup?utm_source=openai))

- **June 2024**: Ahead of a match against Namibia, Ilyas expressed confidence in Oman's preparations, highlighting the team's acclimatization to local conditions and their readiness to perform. ([muscatdaily.com](https://www.muscatdaily.com/2024/06/02/oman-cricket-33/?utm_source=openai))

- **July 2023**: Ilyas led Oman A in the Emerging Teams Asia Cup in Sri Lanka, following the team's commendable performance in the ICC Men’s Cricket World Cup Qualifier in Zimbabwe. ([muscatdaily.com](https://www.muscatdaily.com/2023/07/12/emerging-teams-asia-cup/?utm_source=openai))

- **September 2023**: He captained Oman in the inaugural Gulf T20I Cricket Championship in Qatar, stepping in for the regular skipper Zeeshan Maqsood. ([timesofoman.com](https://timesofoman.com/a/136013?utm_source=openai))

These instances underscore Ilyas's significant contributions and leadership roles in advancing Omani cricket on both regional and international platforms.

citations.title: Ilyas’ blitz powers Oman into semis - Times of Oman
Ilyas to lead Oman at T20 World Cup - Times of Oman
Oman favourites against Namibia, says captain Ilyas - Muscat Daily
Aqib Ilyas to lead Oman A at Emerging Teams Asia Cup in Sri Lanka - Muscat Daily
Aqib Ilyas-led Oman team departs for first Gulf T20I Cricket Championship in Qatar from September 15 - Times of Oman

task_10.query_used: Investigate Oman residential visa and work permit databases through publicly accessible government portals for Aqib Ilyas
task_10.data:
Accessing individual visa or work permit information in Oman is restricted to authorized personnel and the individuals themselves. The Royal Oman Police (ROP) provides an online service for applicants to check their visa status using their application reference number and passport details. This service is accessible through the ROP's official website. ([rop.gov.om](https://www.rop.gov.om/english/Visas.aspx/copyright.aspx?utm_source=openai))

Regarding Aqib Ilyas, publicly available information indicates that he is a Pakistani-born cricketer who has represented the Oman national cricket team since 2015. Born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, his family moved to Oman when he was six months old. He grew up in Muscat and pursued civil engineering studies in Dubai before returning to Oman to continue his cricket career. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

Given his long-term residence and professional engagement in Oman, it is reasonable to infer that he holds the necessary residency and work permits. However, specific details about his visa or work permit status are not publicly disclosed.

citations.title: Royal Oman Police
Aqib Ilyas

task_11.query_used: Search university and educational institution records in Oman and Pakistan for academic history of Aqib Ilyas
task_11.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a cricketer who has represented the Oman national team since 2015. His family relocated to Oman when he was six months old, and he was raised in Muscat. In 2010, Ilyas moved to Dubai to pursue a degree in civil engineering. During his time in Dubai, he was invited to train with the United Arab Emirates national cricket team but chose to return to Oman after completing his studies. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

Specific details about the universities or educational institutions Ilyas attended in Dubai are not publicly available. His academic background in civil engineering is noted, but further information regarding his educational history in Oman or Pakistan is not documented in the available sources.

task_12.query_used: Explore YouTube and cricket video platforms for match footage or interviews featuring Aqib Ilyas playing for Oman national team
task_12.data:
Aqib Ilyas, a prominent figure in Oman's national cricket team, has been featured in various match footage and interviews available online. Here are some notable instances:

- **Match Footage**: In a T20 World Cup 2024 match against Australia, Ilyas showcased his fielding prowess by executing a diving catch to dismiss Glenn Maxwell. This moment is highlighted in an article by Sportskeeda. ([sportskeeda.com](https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/3-breathtaking-catches-oman-players-biggest-stage-ft-aqib-ilyas?utm_source=openai))

- **Interview**: Following a match-winning century against the USA, Ilyas reflected on his performance in an interview with ESPN. ([espn.com](https://www.espn.com/video/clip/_/id/25295002?utm_source=openai))

- **Match Highlights**: During the ICC Cricket World Cup League Two 2023-27, Ilyas scored 61 runs off 98 balls against Canada. Detailed highlights of his innings are available on Cricbuzz. ([m.cricbuzz.com](https://m.cricbuzz.com/player-match-highlights/107009/1/12235/batting?utm_source=openai))

These resources provide insights into Ilyas's contributions to Oman's cricketing successes.

citations.title: 3 breathtaking catches by Oman players at the biggest stage ft. Aqib Ilyas
Aqib Ilyas reflects on his match-winning innings - ESPN Video
Player match highlights - Canada vs Oman, 36th Match, Thu, Sep 26, ICC Cricket World Cup League Two 2023-27 | Cricbuzz.com
